column2: <!empty>
I'd love to taste one, just once,\nbefore I die. Don't suppose you've\ncome across any, have you?
column3: 有机会的话真想尝一尝是什么味道。\n你有没有看到可能是萝妲之树的树啊？

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
Thieves and murderers... What\na sorry state this land is in.
column3: 盗贼骚动之后是发生命案吗...。\n真是，这世间变得太危险了。

column2: What kind of person would\nstoop so low?!
column3: 如果不是盗贼偷的...\n到底犯人会是谁呢？

column2: Ah, well... No sense gettin' myself\nin a knot over it.
column3: 算了，也不勉强你啦。

column2: Holy... Is that a Roda Tree Seed?!
column3: 什么...！\n这个就是萝妲的种子吗！？

column2: P-please, could I have just a\nsmall piece? I just... I just\nwant to sample it!
column3: 拜托你，\n一点点也行，给我一点点...。

column2: ...Actually, you know what? Never\nyou mind. I'm going to hold myself\nback.
column3: ...不，还是不用了。

column2: <!empty>
I'm a little worried that if I try it,\nI'll grow a taste for it, and normal\nfood will never sate my hunger again.
column3: 只能咬个一小口，\n反而会在心里留下遗憾。

column2: It's just good to know that it's\nreal. Maybe some day I'll find one\nmyself. And by then, I'll be ready!
column3: 能够知道它真的存在，我就满足了。\n快乐的事可以留到以后再享用。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
Ahh... What to do, what to do...
column3: 啊...到底该怎么办好呢。

column2: <!empty>
Would you hear out a\nhumble patron of this\nfine watering hole?
column3: 大哥！你愿意听我讲一下\n我正在烦恼的事情吗？

column2: Sure
column3: 听啊

column2: Rather not
column3: 不想听

column2: My name is Rando-- I mean, Donis.\nSorry, Randolph is my brother's\nname. I get us confused sometimes.
column3: 我的名字叫多尼斯。

column2: Somewhere in this general area, I\nlost a beautiful sapphire ring I'd\npurchased as a gift for my wife.
column3: 我用辛苦存下来的私房钱\n买了准备送给老婆当礼物\n的蓝宝石戒指不见了。

column2: <!empty>
Without it, I feel as if I can't\neven face her. Damnable thieves!\nI'll wager this is their doing!
column3: 这样子我怎么回家嘛...\n可恶，这一定是\n那些盗贼干的好事。

column2: Without it, I feel as if I can't\neven face her. Damnable thieves!\nI'll wager this is their doing!
column3: 这样子我怎么回家嘛...\n可恶，这一定是\n那些盗贼干的好事

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
Ohh, whatever shall I do? I can't\ngo home without that ring!
column3: 啊...\n我该怎么办。\n照不到戒指叫我怎么回家嘛...

column2: What the hell is wrong with those\nthieves? Why can't they rob from\nthe rich and give to the poor?!
column3: 那些的盗贼偷我这种平民小老百姓的戒指\n真是太没天良了。

column2: <!empty>
(hic) Oy, Adol... Why so serious?\nLet's shake what we got! (hic)
column3: ...(打嗝)...嗨，亚特鲁。\n怎么啦？一脸衰相的做什么。来啦，咱们一起狂欢。\n(打嗝)。

column2: Hey now, Donis, I think you've had\nenough. Adol, back me up, will you?
column3: 喂，多尼斯。你喝太多酒了。\n喂，亚特鲁。你能不能帮帮我这个忙呀？

column2: ...I don't care...about anything\nanymore... Without that ring...\nI'm doooooooomed...
column3: ......。\n啊...没有戒指的话...我实在是...。

column2: Ahh... How am I ever gonna\nexplain this to my wife?!
column3: 啊。\n我要怎么向我老婆交代呢。

column2: Man, Donis is sure down in the\ndumps. Adol, is there anything\nyou can do for him?
column3: 真是，多尼斯这家伙也有够麻烦的。\n怎样，亚特鲁。你看你能不能帮他一下呢？

column2: Boy, are you ever heartless...
column3: 什么嘛，大哥你也太无情了吧...。

column2: ...You found my ring at the pawn\nshop? And you bought it back?!
column3: 你在交换所找到戒指了？\n并且你还把它买回来了？

column2: Th-thank you so much... Now I can\nactually face my wife again!
column3: 啊，感激不尽...\n这么一来我就有脸面对我老婆了。

column2: I can't offer you much in return,\nbut...you have no idea what this\nmeans to me...so please, take this.
column3: 这个谢礼代表我小小的心意。\n请你无论如何一定要收下！

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
Adol received#02 1500 Gold.
<!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
My ring's been found, everyone!\nA round of drinks, on me!
column3: 为了庆祝找到戒指，\n再乾一杯吧！

column2: Hey, Adol. I finally went home, and\ngave that ring to my wife. Thank\nyou again for saving my hide.
column3: 嗨，亚特鲁。\n我把戒指拿给我老婆了。\n谢谢你，多亏有你的帮忙。

column2: <!empty>
Uuuughh... I think I drank too\nmuch, though... I don't feel so\ngood...
column3: 唔~。\n酒有点喝多了。想吐...呜。

column2: <!empty>
Huh...? The boss is looking for\nme? Yikes! Guess I'd better get\nback to work, then!
column3: 什么？呃...\n老大一直在找我？\n...看来我该回去了。

column2: <!empty>
Hey, you! Stop right there!
column3: 喂！停下来！

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
Kids like you should stay\nindoors! It's dangerous out\nhere! Where are your parents?!
column3: 小孩子不可以出去外面。\n爸爸妈妈没有这样跟你说吗？

column2: ...Well, you don't look\nTHAT young, I guess...
Sorry. I don't mean\nto be a nag.
column3: 抱歉，失礼了。

column2: Shouldn't be addressing\nyou like you're 3 years\nold or something.
column3: 真的很不好意思，\n不小心把你当成小孩子。

column2: Still, can't say I\nrecognize you. Are\nyou from Barbado?
column3: 没见过你哦，你是从巴尔巴多来的吗？

column2:
The lands outside are
teeming with monsters.
You'd be better off
in Minea.
column3: 前方出没的魔物很多，\n不要冒险，进到米内亚城内比较安全。

column2: <!empty>

My big brother was a miner,
but he got attacked by a
monster in one of the tunnels,
and barely made it out alive.
column3:
我的哥哥以前
是在矿山工作的。
他被矿坑深处出现的魔物攻击，
受了好严重的伤呢。

column2: He tried to fight back using\nhis pickaxe, but it didn't\nwork too well.
column3: 他说他用十字镐应战，\n结果一点都不管用。

column2: Still, he made it!\nAnd that's what really\ncounts, right?
column3: 他说能保住一命\n就该庆幸了。

column2:
...But he was the strongest man
here. And if the strongest man
here can't fight back against
the monsters...then who can...?
column3: 但哥哥还是我们那里力气最大的人呢...。\n如果连最强壮的人都无法对抗魔物...\n那还能有谁...

column2: <!empty>
I've been playing with Reah.
column3: 我在跟蕾雅姐姐玩。

column2:
Her word games are way
too hard, though. She's
a grown-up, so I wish
she'd cut me a break!
column3:
蕾雅姐姐
玩接龙游戏太厉害了。
他是大人，
应该要让我一点的才对。

column2: <!empty>
I've been playing with Reah.
column3: 我在跟蕾雅姐姐玩。

column2:
She's really bad at word
games. She can only beat
people when she cheats,
just like my brother!
column3:
蕾雅姐姐
玩接龙玩得好差劲哦。
除非像我哥哥一样作弊，
不然她是赢不了的。

column2: <!empty>
I've been playing with Reah.
column3: 我在跟蕾雅姐姐玩。

column2:
She's really good at
rock-paper-scissors.
She should just let me
win every once in a while!
column3:
蕾雅姐姐、
猜拳太厉害了。
她是大人，
应该让我一点的。

column2: <!empty>
I've been playing with Reah.
column3: 我在跟蕾雅姐姐玩。

column2:
She's really bad at rock-
paper-scissors. She can
only beat me when she
cheats, like my brother!
column3:
蕾雅姐姐
猜拳好弱哦。
除非像我哥哥一样作弊，
不然她是赢不了的。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

Before the monsters showed up,
we used to always play under
the huge tree in the plains...
but we can't do that now.
column3: 魔物到处出没之前，\n原野北边的那棵大树底下，\n本来是我们大家游玩的地方...。

column2: <!empty>
The grownups won't let\nus go outside the city\nwalls anymore.
column3: 大人叫我们不可以出去外面，\n所以最近就没有去了。

column2:
If I could just climb that
tree ONE TIME, I'd never
need to climb another one
ever again!
column3: 成功爬上那棵树的人，\n对其他的树根本就不会放在眼里。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
column3: 我爷爷常常告诉我\n艾斯塔里亚\n以前的各种传说哦。

column2: My grandpa often tells me\nEsterian fairy tales.
column3: 其中我最喜欢听的，就是很久以前\n打败魔物军团的那个\n『银色之剑』的故事。

column2:
My favorite one is the one
about the silver sword used
to defeat the army of monsters
a long time ago.
<!empty>
column3: 我爷爷说\n银色之剑就沉眠在\n这个国家的某个地方呢。

column2: Grandpa says the silver sword\nis still hidden somewhere in\nthis land, too!
column3: 有那把剑的话，\n就可以把魔物一刀两断了。\n如果传说是真的就好了。

column2:
Man, if we had that, I'll
bet we could totally whip
those monsters real good.
It would be awesome!
<!empty>
column3: 我爷爷说\n银色之剑就沉眠在\n这个国家的某个地方呢。

column2: Grandpa says the silver sword\nis still hidden somewhere in\nthis land, too!
<!empty>
column3: 有那把剑的话，\n就可以把魔物一刀两断了。\n如果传说是真的就好了。

column2:
Man, if we had that, I'll
bet we could totally whip
those monsters real good.
It would be awesome!
column3: 咦！这就是传说的那把剑？

column2: Whoa, is that the\nsame sword from\nthe story?!
column3: ...砾害<1--。\n这么说，大哥哥\n你有办法打倒魔物啰？
